english: to reap sth. (receive, benefits, rewards, awards, etc)
german: etw. einheimsen (ugs, Leistungen, Lohn, Preise, etc, 319)

english: to reap a bloody harvest (idiom, literary)
As you sow, so you shall reap. (proverb)
As you sow, so you shall reap. (proverb)
german: Wie man sich bettet, so liegt man.

english: He who sows the wind shall reap the whirlwind. (bibl., proverb, cf, Hosea, 87)
german: Wer Wind sät, wird Sturm ernten. (vgl, Hosea, 87)

english: He who will reap must sow. (proverb)
They sow the wind and reap the whirlwind. (bibl., proverb, Hosea, 87, NIV)
german: Wer Wind sät, wird Sturm ernten. (vgl, Hosea, 87)

english: You reap / harvest what you sow. (proverb, fig)
to reap the fruit of one's labour (Br)
Reap the Wild Wind (film, F, Cecil, B, DeMille)
